results.title: Australia 2001:Thomas Keneally leads the push for a republi
results.creator_credit: John Walsh, Kevin Ryder and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Face the press”.
Paolo Totaro hosts a discussion between Thomas Keneally (Chairman of the Australian Republican Movement), David McNichol (The Bulletin) and D.D. McNichol (The Australian) on the issue of a Repblican Australia by the year 2001. They discuss the potential benefits to Australia becoming a republic, when this is likely to cccur, the politicalisation and composition of the Republican movement, possible candidates for Head of State and selection criteria, the Constitutional Commission 1988 and the liklihood of a hidden agenda within the Republican movement to undermine the current political system.

results.title: Australia : the Land of my dreams = Kraj moich marzen
results.creator_credit: Mariola Gorna and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Born in Poland, Mariola chose to come to Australia. After a long wait in Greece, she was finally granted the right to immigrate to Australia. She tells of the second family she found at Brintons carpet factory and how they were there for her during some of her most difficult times.

results.title: Australia : the great white shark
results.creator_credit: Osford Film Productions, Beyond Productions, Andrew Wight and Liz Wight
results.brief_description: Aboard the historic trading vessel “The Faile”, acclaimed explorers and film makers Andrew and Liz Wight accompanied by a group of marine scientists, sail south from the Australian mainland to Dangerous Reef. This area is a breeding ground for Australian sea lions and is renowned as being the home to the most dangerous predator in the ocean, the Great White Shark. With an array of planned experiments, including a mobile shark cage, the Wight’s experience and capture on film what is internationally accepted as the most dangerous human interaction with a Great White Shark.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Osford Film Productions, Beyond Productions, Andrew Wight and Liz Wight

results.title: Australia : land of the shark
results.creator_credit: Osford Film Productions, Beyond Productions, Andrew Wight and Liz Wight
results.brief_description: A quest for the truth about the behaviour of the Great White Shark, filmed in the remote waters off the South Australian coast. With an array of planned experiments and special equipment, including a custom built shark ‘sub’ , this film captures a host of extraordinary and sometimes frightening interactions with the king of the ocean.

results.title: Australia & company unlimited
results.brief_description: A commentary, expressing faith in Australia’s future, illustrated by various scenes from national life - mainly primary and secondary industries. This film was made for the Ford Motor Company of Australia.

results.title: Australia - my chosen home
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Vinh Nguyen and ACMI
results.brief_description: Vinh’s study trip to Australia in 1997 changed his life forever. Hanoi may have been the place of his childhood memories but Australia would turn out to be a part of his life - his true home.

results.title: Australia - Colony to Nation
results.brief_description:
Australian Aboriginals sail down a river to be followed by white people from England. People from other nations begin to make their journeys to Australia and the film ends with the Olympic flag and people from all nationalities gathered around it.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: Australia's wonderful wildlife
results.creator_credit: GEO Wildlife Documentaries and Grant Young
results.brief_description: The Australian continent has been isolate for a very long time and its animal inhabitants have evolved in isolation to produce a wildlife community very different from that found anywhere else in the world. This video is a sample of Australia’s unique fauna, with 60 seconds of footage on each animal. Some of the animals will be familiar to everyone, others are not so familiar, but all are distinctively Australian. Animals discussed include: Platypus; Koala; Emu; Kookaburra; Taipan and the Shingleback.

results.title: Australia's wheat
results.creator_credit: Kit Guyatt, John Gray, Heinz Fenke, Lilias Fraser, Stephen Carthew, AWB Limited and Fraser Castle Productions
results.brief_description: Provides an outline of the Australian wheat industry, a brief history and general view of growing, harvesting, bulk handling and processing, research and marketing. Shows the industry from the historical beginnings at Experiment Farm and the growing colony of New South Wales, to mechanical innovation, nationwide research and modern transport and handling. Explains the farmer’s work through each season and traces the marketing of the grain from the country silo to the consumers overseas.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kit Guyatt, John Gray, Heinz Fenke, Lilias Fraser, Stephen Carthew, AWB Limited and Fraser Castle Productions

results.title: Australia's urban wildlife
results.creator_credit: Janet Lane, Victoria. Dept. of Conservation, ABC-TV (Australia) and Deborah Boerne
results.brief_description: As seen on the ABC’s “Behind The News” program, this video looks at the ways in which Australia’s native wildlife habitat has been altered by urban development. It also examines the ways in which students and teachers can learn about and value their local fauna. “Our hidden neighbours” is an introduction to native wildlife in urban areas and highlights the effect of urban development on wildlife. “Nocturnal visitors” looks at some of the native nocturnal wildlife found in urban areas. “The Feral menace” explores the problems that introduced animal species have caused for native wildlife. “Attracting wildlife” shows ways of attracting wildlife to your own backyard.
